snippet: For Kanan Makiya, an intellectual who helped make the case for the 2003 invasion, writing a novel became a way to acknowledge his role in what befell his home country.
abstract: Saturday Profile of Kanan Makiya, Middle East scholar at Brandeis University who was foremost Arab intellectual to support 2003 Iraq invasion; Makiya has written novel The Rope as attempt to make sense of what happened to country after fall of Saddam Hussein.

byline.contributor: Falih Hassan contributed reporting from Baghdad.

lead_paragraph: For Kanan Makiya, an intellectual who helped make the case for the 2003 invasion, writing a novel became a way to acknowledge his role in what befell his home country.
